title: A Button of Buttons
narrative:
The Swing-Tree split button component allows 
    you to easily create split buttons in your UIs.
    A split button is a button that has a drop down menu attached to it.
    This allows you to easily add additional functionality to your buttons.
    The split button component is a wrapper around the AlexAndria Software
    JSplitButton component.

features.id: The most simple kind of split button can be built like so:

blocks.text: We create a basic split button which will not have any behaviour.
code: UI.splitButton("I am displayed on the button!")
.add(UI.splitItem("I am the first drop down item."))

blocks.text: The component wrapped by the UI builder is in fact a split button:
This button should have a popup menu with 3 components.
They have the expected names:
code: ((JMenuItem)ui.popupMenu.getComponent(0)).getText() == "I am the first drop down item."

features.id: We can easily build a split button whose text becomes the current user selection:

blocks.text: We create split button displaying the current selection.
The split button has the correct text displayed

features.id: We can easily build a split button where only one item text will have its text displayed:

blocks.text: We create split button displaying only selection "second".
The split button has the correct text displayed
We simulate a user selecting the first button item
The displayed button should still be as it was previously.
We now select the third button item
Again the button text is still the same.
We now simulate a selection on the second item (for which we registered an action).
The displayed button text will have changed because of our selection lambda

features.id: We can register button click events for button items as well as the split button as a whole.

blocks.text: We create split button with 2 different kinds of events.
The split button has the correct text displayed
We select the first item and click the button.
We expect that the button has the default text displayed according to the first action
We select and click the third button.
This should have the same effect as previously.
We now select and click the second button item.
The split button text will be different because the button item action fired last.

features.id: We can specify which item should be initially selected.

blocks.text: We create split button with 3 button click events.
We click the button.
The button has now "2" displayed on it, because of the second split item action.

features.id: It is possible to select more than 1 item.

blocks.text: We create split button with 3 button click events.
We click the button.
The button text now indicates which items were selected and triggered!

features.id: A button item can undo any multi-selection.

blocks.text: We create split button with 3 button click events and a selection action.
We click the button.
The button text now indicates which items were selected and triggered!
We now select the second button item.
The split button text will not have changed (internally the selection should be different however).
We now click the second button item.
The split button text will indicate that now only the second split item button action was triggered!

features.id: We can build a JSplitButton and add components to it.

extraInfo:
Note that adding components to a JSplitButton is not the same as 
            in a normal JButton. The components are added to the popup menu
            and not to the button itself.
            This is because the JSplitButton is a composite component and
            the button itself is not a container.

blocks.text: We create a UI builder node containing a simple split button.
It wraps a JSplitButton.
We add a menu item to the split button.
The split button has a popup menu with one component.
We add another menu item to the split button.
The split button has a popup menu with two components.
We add a split item to the split button.
The split button has a popup menu with three components.
We add a split radio button to the split button.
The split button has a popup menu with four components.

features.id: A JSplitButton and all of its options can be created from a simple enum property.

blocks.text: A Size enum based property.
We create a UI builder node for the enum states.
It wraps a JSplitButton.
There are 3 options.

features.id: A JSplitButton and all of its options can be bound to and created from a simple enum property and bound to an event.

blocks.text: A Colour enum based property and an event.
We create a UI builder node for the enum states.
It wraps a JSplitButton.
There are 3 options.
The button text is initially set to the current selection.
We select the second option.
The tracker will have recorded a selection action event.
The button text will have changed to the new selection.
We click the button.
The tracker will have recorded a button click event.
